result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig Alan Weissgerber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored. No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid Rx. No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.

Remit all fines, costs, and DNA surcharge. Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval. Must take any medications, and only as prescribed for mental health or substance abuse. AODA and follow through. Mental health evaluation and follow through. Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Obtain and maintain full time employment. DNA Sample Due: 7-11-2022.

records.addlTxt:
3:51 PM Defendant Craig Alan Weissgerber in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Craig Alan Weissgerber.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Copy of PSI.
Atty Hansen heard on corrections to PSI.
DA heard - no corrections to PSI.
DA heard on sentencing recommendation.
Atty Hansen heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 2:
4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence.
No credit for time served.
Not eligible for CIP.
Eligible for SAP.
Conditions of extended supervision:
Remit all fines, costs, and DNA surcharge.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with prior agent approval.
Must take any medications, and only as prescribed, for mental health or substance abuse.
No contact with know drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
DNA sample due 07-11-2022.
